name: (1E)-N-hydroxy-1-(4,7,7-trimethylbicyclo[2.2.1]hept-2-yl)propan-1-imine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-878
Reason: 1E-N-hydroxy-1-(4,7,7-trimethylbicyclo[2.2.1]hept-2-yl)propan-1-imine has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components: (1) The basic unit for comparison is 1-propanol, which has a melting point of around -10 degrees Celsius. (2) The hydroxyl group introduces hydrogen bonding potential, which can raise the melting point by approximately +10 degrees Celsius. (3) The methyl group introduces a rigid structure and increases the molecular weight, contributing approximately +10 degrees Celsius. (4) The bicyclic system (4,7,7-trimethylbicyclo[2.2.1]hept-2-yl) adds approximately +30 degrees Celsius due to the increased molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. (5) The imine group introduces a dipole moment, which can contribute approximately +10 degrees Celsius.
